title: Electricity prices for households in Belgium 2010 - 2019 , semi-annually
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Euro cents per kilowatt-hour, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018_S1 to 2014_S2.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2013_S2 to 2012_S1.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2019_S1 to 2018_S1.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2014_S2 to 2013_S2.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2012_S1 to 2011_S1.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2011_S1 to 2010_S1.
gold: This statistic shows the electricity prices for household end users in Belgium semi-annually from 2010 to 2019 . In the second half of 2018 , the average electricity price for households was 29.37 euro cents per kWh . This was an increased from the previous period .
